intro: Lampranthus foliosus, commonly known as the red-hot poker, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant red, tubular flowers that bloom in summer. The plant has succulent, fleshy leaves that help it store water, adapting to its arid environment. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens. Its striking appearance and drought tolerance make it a desirable ornamental plant.
